sense.name: taxes imposed and collected
sense.commentary: LEVY[+quantity][+sum][+money][+tax] Note: refers to a sum of money, not the event of imposing taxes (Sense 2)
sense.examples: You don't have to pay levies on merchandise in duty free shops. There is a sizable levy on these luxury items.

sense.name: the act of imposing taxation
sense.commentary: LEVY[+event][+taxation] Note: implies an agent/actor in a role as initiator or collector of taxes. Note: this sense is a nominalization of the verb 'levy'
sense.examples: The legislature's levy of a new tax on cigarettes will raise revenues for the state. It was hard to enforce the levy of these types of business transactions.

sense.name: the act of conscripting soldiers for an army
sense.commentary: LEVY[+event][+conscription] Note: this sense is a nominalization
sense.examples: Such a levy of young men will not have much public support.

sense.name: the conscripts that form an army
sense.commentary: LEVY[+entity][+group][+people][+soldiers][+conscripts] Note: refers to people, not the event of recruiting them (Sense 3)
sense.examples: The lightly armed local levies were no match for the heavy armor of the enemy.
